comments:
I'm testing version 3.0.0, build 200312030800

I created a plugin through the wizard (popup menu) and it created the code:

It said that IPluginDescriptor (the param in the constructor created by the
wizard) was deprecated. And it didn't work at all (maybe an mistake of me?). It
said a submenu would appear at the view. I tried at the navigator on a txt file
and a java file, no menu appeared.

Constructor:

	public TestePluginPlugin(IPluginDescriptor descriptor) {
		super(descriptor);
		plugin = this;
		try {
			resourceBundle=
ResourceBundle.getBundle("TestePlugin.TestePluginPluginResources");
		} catch (MissingResourceException x) {
			resourceBundle = null;
		}
	}

Forgot to say, MOTIF version.
I just tested with the hello word plugin wizard (create a menu that show a hello
world on a dialog) and it worked.
I'd like to say that the customize perpective of 3.0 is to confuse... maybe my
fault...

In the popup menu tempate wizard, the name filter field is set 
to 'plugin.xml', which means that the popup menu would only appear on files by 
that name.  That is why you did not see it on a random file.
Of course, you could customize that value to whatever you want.

As for the deprecated warnings, they are no longer there.  The build you 
downloaded was a snapshot of a work in progress, and the deprecated classes in 
that build are no more.

I would discourage you from using nightly builds, and rather sticking to 
integration builds and milestone builds.
